name: Joshua de Jong
title: Software Developer
welcome: I currently work at Expeditors Seattle as a software developer for the Enterprise Monitoring team. I have been working with the team to improve the performance of their java code base. So far I've improved multiple code blocks down to O(n) or O(log(n)) time! I have also been helping the team develop their CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure for the release of their Elastic Search based monitoring solution.

I originally started my career at Colorado State University where I studied mathematics and worked as a researcher in a chemistry lab. It was here where I found a passion for coding by developing machine vision tools and numerical models of experiments. After university I started work as a data analyst where I built predictive models, and built an item recommendation system using machine learning!
I am always seeking to challenge myself and learn new skills. If you feel I might be the right person for your team feel free to reach out!
You can find me on LinkedIn, or see my repositories here.
summary: I am a detailed-oriented, responsible and committed developer, with a get-it-done, on-time and top-quality product spirit. Experienced with defining requirements, designing, and implementation of complex algorithms in high paced environments.

details: Planned and led weekly meetings for 25+ undergraduate students that engaged students to learn complex mathematical topics in creative ways.
Actively identified and secured key speakers from industry and academics to present at events.

experience.title: Software Engineer
details: Rewrote mission critical Java code exponentially improving the run time and stability of functions and classes.
Created and maintained fully automated, highly available, zero downtime releases CI/CD pipelines in Gitlab.
Automated common tickets improving response time, customer satisfaction, and alleviating work loads.
Prototyped enterprise monitoring solutions in Python integrating with existing systems and Elasticsearch.

experience.title: Junior Data Analyst
details: Developed and maintained standardized operational reports and dashboards to monitor sales and inventory.
Scrapped, wrangled, and analyzed data from competitor's websites to competitively price products.
Forcasted company's growth and measured the success of advertising campaigns through the use of A/B Testing.
Designed and implemented an item recommendation system based off of a customer's current shopping cart.

experience.title: Research Assistant
details: Developed automated systems to aid in analysis and accurate empirical data collection of chemical reactions.
Modeled experiments and verified the model's integrity with PDE's, regressions, and cross-validation.
Created and maintained a relational database to store experiments and analytics for future enquiries.
Dynamically approached problems with a team and taught statistical modeling techniques to junior researchers.
